intro: [WRONG START] Gelonia racemulosum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil to prevent root rot. It is popular as a houseplant due to its compact size and ease of care. Gelonia racemulosum is often propagated through leaf cuttings or division, making it a favored choice for indoor gardening.
